![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=RILXkCGnJDenQWO5amFezqh2mvR8TM%252BwpAdOn0Xh45OypGfJrk3mdMb5nG6iEb%2F8&s=large)

Jim Atchison

Mayor

(903) 482-5426

mayor@cityofvanalstyne.us

Jim Atchison was sworn in as Mayor of Van Alstyne on June 23, 2020. Prior to that Mayor Atchison served on the Van Alstyne Planning and Zoning Commission for 25 years and the Board of Trustees for the Van Alstyne Independent School District for 7 years.

Jim was born and grew up in Louisville, Kentucky and attended the University of Dayton where he graduated with a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering. He moved to Dallas and began a 37-year career in the defense business for Texas Instruments and Raytheon from which he retired in 2019. Along the way he earned a Master of Science Degree in Engineering Management from Southern Methodist University.

Jim and his wife Melissa moved to Van Alstyne in 1994. Both of their daughters attended Van Alstyne schools and graduated from Van Alstyne High School, and Melissa taught in VAISD for 13 years. Jim and Melissa are active members of the First United Methodist Church in Van Alstyne where Melissa sings in the choir, and Jim serves on the Board of Trustees and the WEE School Board.

Mayor Atchison appreciates the keen sense of community values in Van Alstyne and recognizes the role of our city leadership in that environment. He believes that our challenges include continuing to improve the quality of life of all citizens through attracting desirable retail and industrial businesses, implementing recreational opportunities, supporting our highly acclaimed school district, and partnering with our various non-profit organizations.

The Mayor seeks input from our citizens at Council meetings and via e-mail to work together to establish a course of action for the future of our great city and community.

You can follow the Mayor at
<https://x.com/MayorJim_VA_Tx>

To request a ceremonial document please visit the following link:
[City of Van Alstyne -](https://cityofvanalstyne.us/CeremonialDocument)

Lee Thomas

Council Member, Place 4 and Mayor Pro Tem

(817) 313-1076

c\_thomas1775@hotmail.com

![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=DVl%252BK2%2F44kGvTjVDCJMwnlXJRczCTUOjSeGaGPQkjWLe2HqouiFXWcsbxUyP0gb9&s=large)

Ryan T. Neal

Council Member, Place 1

(903) 482-5426

aldermanplace1@cityofvanalstyne.us

Ryan Neal, elected as City Council Place 1 in 2018, has completed three terms in office. A native of Arlington, Texas, Council member Neal relocated to Van Alstyne in 2012. He co-founded Blue Fountain Wealth, a wealth management firm, and holds a degree in finance from the University of North Texas. His professional base is currently situated in downtown McKinney.

In addition to his professional endeavors, Council member Neal has been actively involved in community service. He dedicated a decade to volunteering in the youth ministry at First Melissa Church in Melissa, Texas, and has been serving the Van Alstyne community since 2018. He contributed his time coaching little league for two years and volunteered with the Chamber of Commerce to enhance business interests in Van Alstyne. Moreover, he played a pivotal role in crafting Van Alstyne's first city charter in 2022 and was among the key figures in developing the downtown social district park.

Council member Neal is happily married to Kassi, and together, they are blessed with two beautiful children. They are active members of Pin Oaks Church in Anna, Texas.

![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=p%2FAn4F5JNPqF6SgJtrQIreiO9x9kxHx4%2FFF9irNhBgXZ7lUqTH%252B5uUjdViXffNBF&s=large)

Marla E. Butler

Council Member, Place 2

(903) 482-5426

aldermanplace2@cityofvanalstyne.us

![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=ZzqadQilH6JFaOtu5tV12QBcZarOgVP8hBV5PZR%2FeVVxkDyMYEH45v%252Bl8Drje0cN&s=large)

Dusty Williams

Council Member, Place 3

(903) 482-5426

aldermanplace3@cityofvanalstyne.us

Dusty Williams was elected to Van Alstyne City Council in May of 2022 under the campaign slogan of: “Preserving Our Past, Planning Our Future.”

Dusty Williams is a 9th Generation Grayson County Resident. His family settled in the Van Alstyne area in the early 1850’s, some 20 years before the town was established with the coming of the Railroad. He has written several books on Grayson County History, as well as given historical presentations at various organizations all throughout the county, including a lecture series at Grayson County College in Van Alstyne.

Not only does he serve as Alderman for the City of Van Alstyne, but he is also the Chairman for the Grayson County Historical Commission, President for the Van Alstyne Historical Society, Vice-President for the Van Alstyne Public Library, Board Member for the Van Alstyne Cemetery, President for the Architectural Review Panel, City of Van Alstyne, and Secretary for the Cannon Cemetery Association. He earned two master’s degrees in education from Texas A&M at Commerce. During the day he teaches 7th Grade Texas History where he not only teaches his students history, but encourages, and promotes their involvement within the community.

He stated that he is glad to be a part of the future of Van Alstyne and to mold it so that it “builds on our past, versus replaces our past.” When asked what legacy he would like to leave behind in Van Alstyne, he stated, “It is not about the legacy I leave, our legacy is already here. It is a matter of making sure the legacy stays. Those who founded this town, and who were here in this community, they started the legacy, and it is our job to keep it going.” He said in one word, Van Alstyne’s legacy so far, is “Community.”

![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=rZY6unBh1WijuS7PtDGC%252BBSUmvC1QE8oqSGSu8wvwRRqlR1IIhdeLMo%252BbNFvxM%2FG&s=large)

Katrina Arsenault

Council Member, Place 5

(903) 482-5426

aldermanplace5@cityofvanalstyne.us

Katrina Arsenault was elected to the Van Alstyne City Council, Place 5, in 2019 and was re-elected in 2021 and 2023.

Katrina and her husband, Keith, relocated from Lubbock, Texas to Van Alstyne in 1999, when Keith was transferred with Texas Instruments.  Katrina has also served on the Van Alstyne Parks Advisory Board, the Van Alstyne Charter Commission and is a new member of the Van Alstyne Culture Club. Katrina is also in the process of joining the Sister Grove Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution (DAR).

Katrina is a 1994 graduate of Eastern New Mexico University Roswell School of Nursing.  She graduated from Western Governors- Texas in 2013, with a Bachelor of Science in Nursing.  Prior to her nursing career, Katrina worked in broadcasting, including radio and television, in New Mexico, Oregon and Texas.

Katrina, along with her husband, raised three VAHS graduates (2001, 2007 & 2011). Katrina spends much of her time with her husband, adult children and ten grandchildren. Katrina enjoys boating, traveling and being involved in her community.

![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=bfabl3lgSXCgOdG4HaOGYEqiKTLvkaUQ4sJasqMUEmep6CXHHeKOLUuzFFoZE4ns&s=large)

Angelica Peña

Council Member, Place 6

(903) 482-5426

aldermanplace6@cityofvanalstyne.us

Angelica Peña was elected as the City of VA Alderman, Place 6 in May of 2023.

She is a native Texan from San Angelo and has lived and worked in Van Alstyne since October of 2019. She is a full time Realtor and helps both buyers and sellers in Grayson, Collin and Fannin counties.

Council member Peña actively volunteers in Van Alstyne and serves as the President of the Van Alstyne Library Board, serves as a member of Georgetown HOA 's Social committee, a member of Partin Elementary's Teacher Appreciation committee, and is the Co-Chair for the Van Alstyne Newcomers group.

Council member Peña and her husband, Rickie Jones, have three beautiful children, Rickie III, Ruby, and Remi. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her family, attending various sporting events, and is an avid music lover.

![](https://www.cityofvanalstyne.us/api/blob/viewBlob?i=wYK%2FQ0bx8pSXRJbE2sYtP365739Wr63tDqaFt47hcrH2w0T3r8%2Fje3FfHWpkpOJv&s=large)
152 N Main Drive, Van Alstyne, TX 75495
[(903) 482-5426](tel:9034825426)
